thread.title: San Diego Restaurant Week deals: where to dine - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: San Diego Restaurant Week deals: where to dine - NewsBreak

title: San Diego Restaurant Week deals: where to dine - NewsBreak
text:
By Amber Coakley ,
1 hours ago
SAN DIEGO (FOX 5/KUSI) — Food lovers, get ready for another gastronomic journey as San Diego Restaurant Week (SDRW) returns this month. More than 100 local restaurants spanning from North County to the South Bay will offer exclusive multi-course menus starting at just $30 from Sunday, Jan. 26 to Sunday, Feb. 2.
Whether you’re a seasoned foodie looking to score a deal, someone eager to try new dining spots or simply want to indulge in a customized culinary experience, SDRW has something for everyone. The event offers a golden opportunity to explore San Diego’s thriving food scene, which is set to impress in 2025.
Hello Kitty Cafe Truck rolls into San Diego for 2025 tour: when to expect it While no tickets are required to participate, organizers stress that reservations are highly recommended. This ensures a smooth and enjoyable experience at participating restaurants, which will feature specially curated menus designed for the event.
To help you decide where to dine, here’s a list of participating restaurants:
333 Pacific (Oceanside) 7 Mile Kitchen (Carlsbad) 94th Aero Squadron Restaurant (Kearny Mesa) Allegro (Little Italy) Amaya (Carmel Valley/Del Mar) Antica Trattoria (La Mesa/Mission Valley) Aqua E Farina (Chula Vista) AquaMare Cucina Italiana (Carmel Valley/Del Mar) Aromi Italian Cuisine (La Mesa) Bali Hai Restaurant (Point Loma/Shelter Island) Balsamico Italian Kitchen (Imperial Beach) Bandar Persian Prime Restaurant (Downtown San Diego) Benihana (Carlsbad/Mission Valley) Blanco Cocina + Cantina (Corondo/San Diego) Bleu Boheme (Kensington) Boujiemana (Kearny Mesa/Mission Valley) Brockton Villa (La Jolla) Bronze Bird (Downtown San Diego) C Level Lounge (Harbor Island) Cacio e Pepe (North Park/University Heights) Cafe Coyote (Old Town) Cafe Sevilla Spanish Restaurant & Tapas Bar (Downtown San Diego) California English (Sorrento Valley) Casa de Bandini (Carlsbad) Casa De Pico (La Mesa) Casa Gabriela (La Mesa) Casa Guadalajara (Old Town) Chart House (Cardiff) City Cruises Tasty Pot (Oceanside) Temaki Bar (Solana Beach) The Amalfi Llama (La Jolla) The Butcher’s Cut (Downtown San Diego) The Field Irish Pub & Restaurant (Gaslamp Quarter) The French Gourmet (La Jolla) The Godfather (Clairemont/Kearny Mesa) The Grill at Torrey Pines (La Jolla) The Prado (Balboa Park) The Smoking Goat (North Park) Tom Ham’s Lighthouse (Harbor Island) Top of the Market (Downtown San Diego) Trattoria Da Sofia (Kensington/North Park) Vincenzo Cucina and Lounge (Little Italy) Vintana Wine + Dine (Escondido) West End Bar & Kitchen (Carmel Valley/Del Mar) Zama (Downtown San Diego) Zest Wine Bistro (Lemon Grove) Consider this an opportunity to experience San Diego’s top restaurants and enjoy a wide variety of dishes at unbeatable prices. Start planning your dining adventure today by browsing through the full list of participating restaurants and their unique offerings.
Visit the official SDRW website to begin planning your eight days of local dining.
